metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git Submodules
What Are Git Submodules?
Git submodules let you include one Git repository inside another as a subdirectory.
content.html: Git submodules let you include one Git repository inside another as a subdirectory.

content.text: This is useful for adding libraries or dependencies managed in separate repositories, while keeping their commit history separate.
content.html: This is useful for adding libraries or dependencies managed in separate repositories, while keeping their commit history separate.

content.text: Why Use Submodules?
Submodules are helpful when you want to:
content.html: Submodules are helpful when you want to:

content.text: How to Add a Submodule
To add a submodule to your project, use:
content.html: To add a submodule to your project, use:

content.code_html: git submodule add https://github.com/example/library.git libs/library

content.text: This creates a subdirectory libs/library and updates .gitmodules with the submodule info.
content.html: This creates a subdirectory libs/library and updates .gitmodules with the submodule info.

content.text: How to Clone a Repo with Submodules
When you clone a repository with submodules, you need to fetch their contents separately:
content.html: When you clone a repository with submodules, you need to fetch their contents separately:

content.code:
git
submodule init

git
submodule update
content.code_html:
git submodule init
git submodule update

content.text: Or do it all at once when cloning:
content.html: Or do it all at once when cloning:

content.code_html: git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/user/repo.git

content.text: How to Check Submodule Status
To see the current commit and state of your submodules, use:
content.html: To see the current commit and state of your submodules, use:

content.code_html: git submodule status

content.text: How to Run Commands in All Submodules
You can run a command in every submodule. For example, to check their status:
content.html: You can run a command in every submodule. For example, to check their status:

content.code_html: git submodule foreach git status

content.text: How to Update Submodules
To update submodules to the latest commit from their remote repository:
content.html: To update submodules to the latest commit from their remote repository:

content.code_html: git submodule update --remote

content.text: How to Remove a Submodule
To remove a submodule:
About .gitmodules
The .gitmodules file keeps track of all submodules and their paths. Edit this file if you move or remove submodules.
content.html: The .gitmodules file keeps track of all submodules and their paths. Edit this file if you move or remove submodules.

content.code_html:
[submodule "libs/library"]
  path = libs/library
  url = https://github.com/example/library.git

content.text: Troubleshooting and Best Practices
Note: Submodules are powerful, but can be tricky to manage.
content.html: Note: Submodules are powerful, but can be tricky to manage.

content.text: Only use them if you really need to track another project at a specific commit.
content.html: Only use them if you really need to track another project at a specific commit.
